ac:rich-text-body.p: This page has been generated with a tool.

p: If you are a user who wants to publish pages to Confluence, you should install the package markdown-to-confluence from PyPI. If you are a developer who wants to contribute, you should clone the repository md2conf from GitHub.
This page demonstrates the various features of converting a Markdown document into an XHTML document compliant with the Confluence Storage Format.
Text with bold, italic, monospace, underline and strikethrough.

Absolute link to an external location or relative link to a heading in the same document. Relative links to other pages are also supported if you are synchronizing a directory tree, not a single file. "Naked" links such as URLs and e-mails are automatically identified: https://example.com and me@example.com. Relative URLs to locations not exported may be skipped.

Markdown has no native support for admonitions. Admonitions that follow the Python-Markdown syntax are converted into Confluence structured macros, which are shown as info panels.

ac:rich-text-body.p: This is an information panel with an explicit title.
This is the second paragraph with a link.
This is a structured macro panel showing a tip.
This is a structured macro panel showing a note.
This is a structured macro panel showing a warning.

p: UTF-8 characters outside of the ASCII range are also supported: e.g. árvíztűrő tükörfúrógép.
